com.yantra.api.wms.putaway

Interface createActivityDemand

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.WMSApi, YIFApi

    public interface createActivityDemand

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document createActivityDemand(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      createActivityDemand provides ability to create an activity demand for a SKU/LicensePlate for fulfilling demands placed by shipment or work order.

    • Method Detail

      • createActivityDemand

        org.w3c.dom.Document createActivityDemand(YFSEnvironment env,
                                          org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                   throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                          java.rmi.RemoteException

        createActivityDemand provides ability to create an activity demand for a SKU/LicensePlate for fulfilling demands placed by shipment or work order. Activity demands are placed for performing operations like quality inspection, x-docking etc. This information is used at put away for fulfilling product being demanded for various purposes based on the activity demand setup. The demand can be either against shipment, order or work order. It is possible to create activity demands without specifying against which shipment, order or work order should it be created. In this case item information must be provided along with demand quantity. If the demand is for SKU, then quantity of item that is demanded (DemandQty) may or may not be passed. If demand quantity is not passed then demand is considered to be infinite and this demand never gets satisfied. However creation of infinite activity demands is prevented if it is not specified against which shipment, order or work order is this demand. If the demand is against a license plate, then PalletId/CaseId (not the SKU) must be passed. If demand is against some portion of a pallet, only the SKU details along with the demand quantity should be passed and PalletId should not be passed. The user can also pass the DemandLocationId. In such a case put away location considered for the activity demand would be the provided DemandLocationId.


        While creating activity demand, all possible attributes of incoming inventory needs to be passed, since the getPutawayLocations looks for an exact match when looking for diversion preferences. E.g. If incoming inventory has the following attributes specified on it - InventoryStatus, Segment, SegmentType, then even the activity demand, if necessary, needs to be created passing all these attributes and not a partial list of it. If incoming inventory has these attributes specified, but if the activity demand is created for only subset of these, then getPutawayLocations will not match completely for the activity demand and will not divert appropriately even though subset of these attributes match.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Events Raised:
        Raised during the transaction CREATE_ACTIVITY_DEMAND.

          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised upon successful execution of createActivityDemand.
            Data published - WMS_CREATE_ACTIVITY_DEMAND.ON_SUCCESS.xml

        Audits: None

        Pre Conditions:

      • Activity demand being created should not already be existing in the database
      • Shipment for which activity demand is being created should exist in the database.
      • Work order for which activity demand is being created should exist in the database.

        • Post Conditions:
        Output XML for create activity demand is generated. An activity demand gets created in YFS_Activity_Demand table.

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
An XML document that contains the details of the activity demand created. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

Throws:
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
